https://www.thetimes.com/article/holy-cl.text: Last week, Justin Welby, the Archbishop of Canterbury, apologised for likening those ignoring the climate crisis to politicians who turned a blind eye to the Nazis in the 1930s. While his outspokenness could be considered an attempt to atone for his previous life as an oil industry executive — he worked in the 1980s for the French oil company Elf Aquitaine in Paris and Enterprise Oil in London — Welby is not the only member of the devout ruffling feathers in the name of saving God’s green earth.\nA radical fringe of Christian activists has taken up the battle against climate change as a new mission and has been causing havoc across the country. The direct action is a sharp contrast with the usual view
